definitions.definition: what happens or appears if you do not make any other choice or change, especially in a computer program

examples.text: The default option is to save your work every five minutes.
All my life, envy has been my default emotion.

definitions.definition: failure to do something that must be done by law, especially paying a debt

examples.text: The company is in default on the loan.
Mortgage defaults have risen in the last year.

definitions.definition: a game or competition can be won by default if there are no other people, teams, etc. taking part

examples.text: He became world champion in 2007 by default.

definitions.definition: if something happens by default, it happens because you have not made any other decision or choices that would make things happen in a different way

examples.text: I became a teacher by default rather than by design.

definitions.definition: because of a lack of something

examples.text: They accepted what he had said **in default of** any evidence to disprove it.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French defaut, from defaillir ‘to fail’, based on Latin fallere ‘disappoint, deceive’.
